title: meet penarth man designed new town parklets
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJohn Davies, owner ofCandid Creative Studio, worked with the Vale of Glamorgan Council on the parklets after taking part in a competition to design and manage the installation of artwork to celebrate Penarth.In all it took around a month to complete, from the initial conceptualisation meetings through to agreeing the final artwork.ldquoWe carefully balanced the needs for the parklets to have an identity, promote and shout about Penarth, and also appeal to the public at large, he said.Parklets are extensions of trading space built out into existing parking bays that allow businesses to safely accommodate a greater number of customers.D signs of Bridgend fitted the vinyl artwork just in time for outdoor hospitality to open on Monday, April .ldquoIt is Penarthrsquos very own unique and erse architectural heritage which formed the inspiration to the parklets artwork, he added.ldquoThe townrsquos famous landmarks, as well as some lesser known ones, join quirky seaside elements, to decorate the glass .The parklets offer a great opportunity for hospitality businesses to welcome back customers, with some shelter, while they cannot currently open inside.MORE NEWS:lsquoHe will always be in my heartrsquo: Woman raises over pound, in memory of childhood friendPenarth man ordered to repay pound, after selling counterfeit goodsCan you help  Appeal after boombox, toilet and more dumped at Vale parkThe final designed parklets can be seen outside Willmorersquos  on Stanwell Road, and Foxys Deli, Victoria Roadand Gin .ldquoOutside the business opportunities, on a sunny day they also animate Penarthrsquos streets, encourage residents and tourists to stay a little longer in the town and enjoy everything Penarth has he added.ldquoBusinesses and the public alike have enjoyed using the parklets since last week, and feedback on the artwork has been very positive.     For Mr Daviesrsquo graphic design businesses, he says the last few months since the lockdown on December  has lsquoremained steady.rsquoldquoI am very lucky to work with a range of clients ndash the NHS, national charities, ambitious locals, small businesses, and everyone in between ndash who have needed to adapt themselves to the changing landscape caused by the pandemic.ldquoThat ability to stay nimble has allowed my clients to weather the storm so far, and I am faithful that will continue as we see the pandemic in the rear view mirror. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: rnli penarth looking lifeboat station historian
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe role will see them revealing the stories behind the townrsquos leboat station since it re-opened in , as well as collecting information and statistics on the boats and launches.The volunteer will research and collect oral histories from the many people who have been involved with the station over the years.From past boat crew and family members to the hundreds of volunteers and people throughout the community who have come into contact with the station over the last .RNLI Penarthrsquos first leboat station was built in  for a cost of pound, before being relocated in  when Penarth Esplanade was constructed.The station closed in , and the town had no leboat station for another  years. Not until the increasing popularity of Penarth as a destination for tourism and leisure boating saw the need for leboat services to be re-established in .MORE NEWS:#The current purpose-built station was constructed in .The history of the th century station has been well-documented, but not its history since , which is what this new role will uncover.Laurie Pavelin, chair of RNLI Penarth Leboat Station, said: ldquoPenarthrsquos leboat station has been a central part of the community since , and in that time it has played a part in many peoplersquos lives.ldquoThe people of Penarth have volunteered, fundraised, attended events, brought safety lessons to schools, and played a part in RNLIrsquos lesaving work in so many dferent ways.ldquoWersquore looking forward to welcoming a new volunteer historian who will make sure those stories are preserved for the community. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Watch: Senedd Election : Meet the new MSs for South Wales CentralAndrew RT Davies" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentBOTH the Conservative and Plaid Cymru won two seats in the South Wales Central region.Rhys ap Owen and Heledd Fychan were elected for Plaid, with Welsh Conservative leader Andrew RT Davies retaining his seat in the region, along with Joel James.Neither Mr Davies nor Mr Jones attended the count at the Barry Memo Arts Centre today, despite the Welsh Conservatives securingtheir best ever Senedd result ndash winning  seats.On the partys overall result, Mr Davies said: ldquoFirstly, Irsquod like to say a huge thank you to our outstanding set of Welsh Conservative candidates, activists and staff whorsquove worked incredibly hard throughout this campaign and secured the partys best ever Senedd result.ldquoThe team has gone above and beyond and deserve great credit for the positive campaign wersquove run right across Wales, and I am thrilled to see Natasha Asghar make history in South Wales East by becoming the first female from a BAME background to be elected to the Senedd.ldquoAs a party we are also delighted to have secured constituency seats in the Vale of Clwyd and Brecon and Radnorshire, and increased seats on the regional lists, resulting in our highest ever representation in the Senedd with  members.ldquoItrsquos been an unconventional campaign and itrsquos clear incumbency and continuity has played a signicant part. To that end, I would like to offer my sincere congratulations to Mark Drakeford and Welsh Labour on a successful campaign.ldquoThe election has been fought in good spirit by political parties in Wales and I would like to pay a final word of thanks to the many officials across the country whorsquove allowed this election to take place in a safe and effective manner.Plaid Cymru gained an extra seat this election, which was occupied by Ukip in , secured  seats in the Senedd in total and meant Labour fell short of a majority in Wales.Speaking on the win, Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru said she feels ldquoincredibly honoured, humbled and excited and that there will be a lot of ldquoreading and preparing in the coming days.     Spoke with @heleddfychan after Plaid secured two seats at the South Wales Central counts #SeneddVote pic GKeJwmdash BrookeMay , ldquoI know the first thing that I want to focus on in the Senedd is fighting for independent inquiry into the  floods that devastated communities from the Vale of Glamorgan right to the Cynon Valley.ldquoSo thatrsquos definitely one of my first priorities.ldquoGiven that we werenrsquot able to campaign until April  or knock any doors Irsquom extremely proud that wersquove achieved an increase in number of members we have in the Senedd.Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyldquoPersonally in Pontypridd we raised the vote by four percent, which I was incredibly proud of and I think the fact that we have so many new, fresh faces coming to the Senedd means that there is a lot of excitement about what we will be able to achieve as a group.Mr ap Owen added: "Its sinking in now slowly. It always looked likely that we were going to get regional seats here in South Wales Central but we dont quite believe it until it actually happens."Rhys ap Owen of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyHe says that campaigning during the coronavirus pandemic has been "dficult" and "unusual.""Usually we would be knocking doors for well over a year before an election and we havent been able to do that so it has been a very dferent election to any I have experienced."The full results are below:Welsh Labour ndash ,Welsh Conservatives ndash ,Plaid Cymru - ,Wales Green Party ndash ,Welsh Liberal Democrats ndash ,Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party - ,Propel - ,Ukip - Scrap the Assembly Senedd ndash ,Reform UK - ,No More Lockdowns - ,Gwlad - The Welsh Independence Party - ,Britains Communist Party - Alan Coulthard ndash Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition - Workers Party ndash  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labours alun michael re elected south wales pcc
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAlun Michael" Labours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCC for third timeAlun Edward Michael" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentALUN Michael has been re-elected as the Police and Crime Commissioner for South Wales.The Welsh Labour politician has been serving as the PCC since the role was created in , and will continue to do so for another four years after winning  per cent of the total vote.Conservative candidate Steve Gallagher came in second with  per cent.Among first preference votes, Mr Michael received , ndash or . percent ndash falling short of the  per cent needed to win re-election.Alun Michael speaking after his winOnce the top two were confirmed, the second preference votes were counted ndash those whose first choice was eliminated ndash which saw Mr Michael elected with , votes, and Steve Gallagher had ,.Speaking on his win, Mr Michael said: ldquoItrsquos been a very strange election, coming as it does in the period of Covid-.ldquoSo my first thanks are to the other candidates who have shown stamina through that period.MORE NEWS:ldquoWe took part in a number of speech debates and they were constructed exchanges about things that matter to the electorate of South Wales.ldquoThank you to all the staff who have been involved in the count, including the police officers who have been here to deal with any outbreaks but fortunately they havenrsquot had to deal with.ldquoYou have all shown incredible stamina throughout the last few days with the challenges of the count in this period of Covid-.ldquoAnd thank you in particular to the electorate of South Wales across the  constituencies. I take very seriously indeed the responsibilities the votes cast today place on my shoulders in trying to deliver and to continue to improve the effectiveness of policing.ldquoMy commitment is to do that with renewed energy.     The job of a PCC is to oversee how crime is tackled in their area. They hold their forces to account and set local force priorities and budgets. They also scrutinise the chief constable with the power to appoint and dismiss them.They also work with local partners to prevent crime. The hope is that their democratic mandate from the public makes them more accountable and able to respond to local peoplersquos concerns.First preference votes:Second preference votes:Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: can say penarth e bike expansion
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityWhen the fleet of  e-bikes and five stations was launched in November last year thanks to funding from The Vale of Glamorgan Council, it became the first public electric bike share scheme in Wales.Now thanks to its success, funding has been made available to expand the scheme into Dinas Powys.An online public consultation is being launched by nextbike today , where people can say where they would like to see a station installed and why.Nextbike UK MD, Krysia Solheeim, said: ldquoThe scheme has proved incredibly popular to date, with more than , journeys made and , km cycled so far."Thanks to its success, we want to expand the station network to allow convenient access to even more people.ldquoBike share schemes can have such a positive impact on peoplersquos lives in many ways, from the physical and mental health benefits that cycling brings, to the reduction in congestion and CO emissions that comes from cycling instead of using motorised transport.MORE NEWS:ldquoWersquore really keen to hear from the public about where they would like to see the new stations situated. Our bike share schemes are there to benefit the whole community, which is why we want to hear from as many people as possible.Nextbike docking stations have to be close to popular destinations such as existing transport links, job centres, supermarkets and other shops be in an area of high footfall be highly visible and easy to find have enough space to allow safe movement of pedestrians and people with limited mobility and be accessible by van or bike trailer to allow the nextbike service team to maintain the bikes and stations.     Final decisions will be made based on the above criteria, in addition to the ability to get power to the locations, which is determined by power providers.Councillor Peter King, Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood Services and Transport Vale of Glamorgan Council, said: ldquoThe nextbike e-bike hire scheme in Penarth has proved extremely successful."Since its launch, the hire of the bikes has been steadily increasing.ldquoWith the onset of summer, we have implemented a new docking station at Cosmeston, and very soon there will be a new docking station in Sully."I am convinced the scheme will only go from strength to strength.ldquoTwo additional docking stations in Dinas Powys will complement the existing nextbike network within the Vale of Glamorgan and provide an additional sustainable transport link between these three areas."I would encourage Dinas Powys residents to respond to the consultation as itrsquos important they are located where they are accessible to as many people as possible.Penarthrsquos existing stations are located at the Esplanade, Llandough Hospital, Windsor Road, Penarth Train Station, the Barrage and the recently-installed Cosmeston.While the Penarth bikes can currently only be rented and ed to Penarth stations, the ambition is to eventually link the scheme to nextbikersquos Cardf fleet, meaning commuters will be able to use the e-bikes to make the journey between the town and the city with ease.E-bikes are a combination of a conventional bike with a motor that take some of the effort out of pedalling for the rider. With top speeds of km per hour, the e-bikes can cover greater distances in less time and with less effort than conventional cycles.E-bike rental costs pound per  minutes for customers with a monthly or annual membership, or pound per  minutes on a pay as you ride basis.The consultation runs until May . To take part, visitwww.nextbike en dinas-powysor get in touch with suggestions on social media via @nextbikeUK. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: wales send hundreds ventilators india
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Welsh Government and NHS Wales are providing around  oxygen concentrators and more than  ventilators which are due to leave for India in the coming days.Health minister Vaughan Gething said: ldquoCovid- is a global threat and as such it is right that we are part of the global response, supporting other nations.ldquoWe have worked closely with the UK Government and the Government of India on the logistics in arranging for these supplies to be transported to India and distributed to the hospitals where they are needed most.Mr Gething and chairman of Waless branch of the British Association of Physicians of Indian OriginProfessor Keshav Singhal visited the NHS Wales National Distribution Centre on Monday, May , to inspect the supplies.MORE NEWS:Flights are being arranged by the Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: hundreds thousands spent two roads vale now wont get built
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFor several years Vale of Glamorgan council was drawing up plans to build a road from the A to the M, and another road bypassing Dinas Powys.But last month the Welsh Government announced it would not fund building these new roads, as part of its new transport strategy which focuses on public and active transport.Now the Vale council has revealed the total cost spent on these two roads which have now been cancelled: pound,.More NewsLabours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCCDisruption on train lines between Wales and London todayLook whorsquos just been in court from Barry and St AthanThe costs include hiring consultants to draw up plans for where the roads would potentially go, as well as y public consultation to seethere were support for them.The road from the A at Sycamore Cross to the M at Junction  proved highly unpopular as concerns ranged from houses getting knocked down to ancient woodland felled.That road has cost pound,, which was funded by grants from the Welsh Government.The road bypassing Dinas Powys however was generally supported by the public, and was part of a wider project to improve transport infrastructure in the village like better bus shelters and cycling routes. The bypass could have cut congestion in Dinas too, a current problem.The wider Dinas transport project has cost pound,, mostly from Welsh Government, but including pound, from the Vale council.Councillor Peter King, cabinet member for transport, said: ldquoWelsh Government is moving very much away from road building into tackling climate change, which I really find some dficulty objecting to.ldquoIt has always frustrated me that the work was seen as the Dinas Powys bypass. But it wasnrsquot mdash it was the Dinas Powys transport infrastructure, because it included all sorts of things, including cycle networks and better access to train stations.     He revealed the costs during a meeting of the full council on Monday, April , after a question from Cllr Ian Johnson, leader of the Plaid Cymru group on the Vale.However some of the wider works to improve transport around Dinas could still be funded where, like from the Cardf Capital Region, a body of  councils across south-east Wales. One project that could go ahead includes a cycle route from Newport to Barry.Cllr King said: ldquoWe think we can probably pursue some of [wider work] through the city region, and we have also been awarded money for the active travel Newport to Barry route. So some of the other elements of the transport infrastructure we can pursue.ldquoBut wersquoll wait until after the election [on May ] to see whorsquos in charge, before we decide what to do next. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: laurence llewelyn bowen joins campaign transform plas llanmihangel
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityOne of the finest and most complete early gentry houses in the Vale of Glamorgan, Plas Llanmihangel is currently on the market for pound. million. Rather than see it go into private occupancy, Connect to Purpose aims to purchase and restore the Grade  listed fortiedmanor house, and turn it into a safe and tranquil retreat fordisadvantaged young people and their families from across South Wales.Help and support offered to families will include personal development coaching, health and wellbeing therapies, education and creative arts , as well as opportunities to commune with nature in the surrounding countryside and play their part in the conservation of the manor.Plas Llanmihangel. Picture: Trip AdvisorThecharity also intends to share the unique historic home with the wider community, byoffering bed and breakfast, and holiday rental accommodation for public use delivering wellbeing retreats and open days, and holding an annual medieval festival of arts.MORE NEWS:Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, said: "I was lucky enough to fall in love with Plas Llanmihangel over a decade ago, filming its fairytale gothic glory for the BBC series lsquoHidden Houses of Walesrsquo."What struck me then, and gives me so much pleasure now, is the fact that this building is such a powerful time capsule, with the ability to take visitors back to so many dferent, extremely important, moments that defined the history of Wales and indeed the history of the UK."With this in mind I am compelled to support this extraordinarily exciting initiative to revivy one of my favourite Welsh buildings and use it to help young people learn the skills they need to create the kind of le for themselves that they desire.     In order to purchase Plas Llanmihangel, the charity has launched acrowdfunding page.Trustee of Connect to Purpose, Georgina Saralis, said: ldquoOur aim is to save and sympathetically restore this spectacular property and create a comfortable family home to be shared with the local community and visitors alike."Through a programme of education, therapy, creative arts and coaching, we will offer disadvantaged young people and their families the support, time and space needed to find a way through their dficulties.To find out more about the project, visitwww.plasllanmihangel. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. His teacher is really good and lovely.ldquoThe whole family enjoys music, but none of play an instrument like Charlie. Hersquos been playing classical piano since he was seven, but has self-taught himself music like blues, boogie woogie and rock lsquonrsquo roll.You can watch the video on Facebook here.OTHER NEWS:Charlie, who is currently doing his GCSEs, taught himself other genres of music through YouTube videos and often entertains his family with musical numbers on his electric piano.A performance he gave at Barrys Memo Arts Centre when he was  went down a storm according to Ms Wilson, who hopes hell have the opportunity to perform live in future.His classical piano teacher is from Razzle Dazzle Theatre School. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: mayor vale glamorgan re elected second term

These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe mayor holds a ceremonial role, representing the council in public events, and chairing meetings of the council. The post is usually held for a year. It is a separate position from the council leader.The annual general meeting of the council was the first to be broadcast live online since the start of the coronavirus pandemic.The council had previously been uploading recordings of public meetings days after they were held, but faced criticism for the delays.MORE NEWS:The mayor was nominated for re-election by her party colleague Cllr Gwyn John, who said: ldquoCllr Jayne Norman has been on this council since ."She has worked very hard over the last year and previous years as a councillor.ldquoBut last year in her role as mayor, it has been extremely dficult for her and wersquore absolutely delighted to nominate her to continue her role as mayor."Irsquom sure Cllr Norman this year will be able to carry out her duties to excellence.On being re-elected, she said: ldquoThank you to all for my appointment. I hope this year will see us get back to as close as possible to normal.Cllr Rhiannon Birch was also elected as deputy mayor. The Labour councillor is also leader of Penarth Town Council.The councilrsquos leader, deputy leader, and cabinet remain unchanged this year. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: penarth rfc pay tribute lovely human being
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityBorn in Penarth in , Stu, one of the four sons of local man Len Davies, went to St Joseph School, where he started playing rugby, together with the current club president John Davey.After school, he joined the Royal Navy, where he spent his entire rugby playing career aboard HMS Bulwark, HMS Raleigh, HMS Devonshire and HMS Centaur, the later as captain of the first XV.He ed to civilian le in , when he joined the marine department of Cardf Port Authority as operations manager.During his time with the Port Authority he met again his old school friend John Davey, at the time the supervisor of the Port Cargo operations and also the secretary of Penarth RFC.John talked his old school friend into joining the Penarth RFC club committee, taking over as kit manager, a position he retained for the following  years, before the outbreak of the coronavirus epidemic.In due course, Stu Davies became the clubrsquos main statistician, having managed to compile the post-war club database, which is now widely used by the club.ldquoWithout his extraordinary comprehensive and accurate work, the volume The Spirit of Penarth would have never been published, said author and former club secretary Chris Thau.Former Penarth RFC chairman Mike Gooding has described Stu as one of the kindest and most considerate men he had the privilege to deal with in his entire playing and administrative career with the seaside club.He said: ldquoI cannot imagine the club without him, somewhere in the background, with his little notebook keeping track of scores and scorers."Stuart was a proper gentlemen and I have not met anybody who could say a bad word about him."He was a lovely human being, full of compassion and humanity. He was just one of a kind and will be sorely missed.     Stuart was a good family man. He married Janet, a NHS nurse, and they had a wonderful daughter Rhinna, whom he absolutely adored.Sadly, during the last couple of years his health had deteriorated, though he made brave efforts to carry on trying to help the struggling rugby club. At the end of October he had a stroke while driving his car and ended up in hospital, where the Covid- lockdown prevented him from seeing his family for several months, which left him very upset and both Janet and Rhinna heartbroken. ldquoHe lost ten stones in weight and seemed to have aged  years in  days, explained his daughter.Thankfully, he was determined to see his loved ones and say goodbye, as Rhinna explained, so he resolutely battled against the odds, making sure he was able to see them by the end of April when the lockdown was relaxed.ldquoHe has waited for us," said Rhinna. "We went to see him and mum said that he was waiting for us and his brother Keith to say goodbye.There is very little doubt Penarth RFC will never be the same without Stu Davies. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: coronavirus one three adults wales fully vaccinated
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAs of Tuesday,  per cent of Welsh adults have now received their first dose of the vaccinewhile , second doses have also been administered."I am extremely grateful to all our NHS colleagues and all the volunteers across Wales whose continuous hard work and dedication is making our excellent progress through our COVID- vaccination programme possible," said health minister Vaughan Gething."Soon we will have given two million first doses and one million second doses, which is truly phenomenal progress in our fight against Covid-.":Earlier this week, the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisationsaid, as a precautionary measure, people under  with no clinical risk factors who are not yet vaccinated, should be offered an alternate to Oxford AstraZeneca vaccine."We have immediately implemented this change into our programme," said Mr Gething."The appropriate vaccine will be made available at peoplersquos appointments."We do not envisage that this will lead to a delay to the roll out of our vaccine programme in Wales. We are continuing to work towards the third milestone set out in our strategy, which is to offer a vaccine to everyone aged  and over by July ."As we have regularly statedvaccine supply allows us to move faster than we will do so."Everybody who has already had a first dose of the AstraZeneca vaccine should be reassured that they should receive a second dose of the same brand, irrespective of age, in line with JCVI advice. Medical exemptions may apply to a very small minority."The AstraZeneca vaccine has already saved thousands of lives and remains safe and effective for the majority of the population. Over .million people have received the AstraZeneca vaccine in Wales since January, with very few cases of the rare clotting with thrombocytopenia event."     What to doyou havent had your appointmentPeople in the Aneurin Bevan University Health Board region who have not yet received their vaccination appointment have been encouraged to contact the health board.If you received a first dose of Pfizer vaccine between December  and the end of February but have not received notication of second dose, you should complete the form at abuhb.nhs.wales coronavirus covid--vaccineFor people who had an AstraZeneca first dose between January  and February  but not received notication of second dose, they should also complete a form at the website above.If you are aged  and above and have not received your Covid- vaccination appointment, visit the aged  and above section of the vaccine page on the health board website.If you are clinically extremely vulnerable or have underlying health conditions that would classy you as priority group  or  under the JCVI guidance, contact your GP practiceyou have not received a vaccination invitation. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. It also has an en suite bathroom fitted with a contemporary white suite including a double ended bath and fully tiled walk in shower cubicle.The family bathroom is ft by ft and has a modern white suite including a bath with spa jets and large glazed shower cubicle.On the second floor you will find adaptable accommodation which could form a flat or provide independent living for older children living at home.The central sitting room is ft by ft and has low doors to eaves cupboards.There are two bedrooms on this floor along with a study area and a bathroom with a double ended bath and a walk in shower cubicle with glazed entry door, frosted double glazed window and recessed lighting.At the front of the property there is a U-shape, tarmac in  out drive providing parking for several cars.To the rear is a very private, wide high-quality paved sitting area with floor lighting which extends into a covered outdoor kitchen, built-in barbecue and sink, lighting, heating and sound system with enclosed store room off.     More NewsBarry ramblers walk the Skirrid in MonmouthshireCardf and Vale College apprentice crowned the best in the UKMayor of Vale of Glamorgan re-elected for second termTo the side of the house is an exceptionally private Astro turfed play area enclosed by ft high fencing with access to a substantial detached outbuilding ided into two parts providing a useful general store with deep shelving and a separate home office.This property is on the market with Herbert R Thomas, Cowbridge. title: eluned morgan replaces vaughan gething wales health minister
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMark Drakeford was sworn in as First Minister earlier today and has now issued a reshuffling of Welsh Governments cabinet - in a surprise move Eluned Morgan has replaced Vaughan Gething as Wales health minister.Mr Gething - who had been in his previous post of Wales health minister for five years - has been appointed as Wales economy minister, replacing Ken Skates who is leaving the government.Mr Skates had also been in his post for five years.Announcing the decision, First Minister Mark Drakeford said: ldquoKen has been a real strength in Cabinet and a voice for North Wales. He will continue speaking up for North Wales and for Welsh Labour, but in a dferent role. We will miss his energy and passion.ldquoVaughan becomes Economy Minister at a crucial point in time ndash the pandemic is not just a public health emergency but also an economic one.Jeremy Miles will be involved with education. Julie James has also been appointed to a new cabinet role as minister for climate change, with Lee Waters as her deputy.The new cabinet is expected to meet soon to finalise Fridays coronavirus lockdown restrictions review. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: irish cup final covid test event nis emergence lockdown
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityStormont ministers met on Thursday to discuss further relaxations to the coronavirus regulations.Up to , fans will be able to sign up to attend the clash at Mourneview Park Football Stadium in Lurgan, Co Armagh, on May .Access will be strictly controlled and spectators, teams and staff will be required to take a Covid test before and after the match, with proof of a negative result to be provided on arrival. vw,vw,px, px"Members of the public enjoy a drink and a meal in Belfast following the reopening of outdoor hospitality The Executive also confirmed that reduced social distancing measures will be in place for the purposes of this event only. No food or beverages will be served.As they met on Thursday, ministers heard that the data around the virus ldquocontinues to have a generally positive direction of travel.Indoor hospitality is set to reopen on May  with mitigations, subject to a review on May .Mitigations include permitting up to six people to sit together, removingthe restriction on the number of households they can be from.Indoor visits in a domestic setting are also to be allowed involving six people from no more than two households and indoor visitor attractions including amusement arcades, bingo halls, museums, galleries and cinemas are to reopen from May .Also from May , the Stay Local message is to be removed, numbers increased for indoor gatherings, numbers increased to  for outdoor gatherings, libraries are to reopen, and schools can resume extra-curricular activities, indoor extra-curricular sports, outdoor inter-schools sports and day educational visits.NI #COVID data has been updated:#  positive cases, sadly  death has been reported in past  hours,, vaccines administered in totalDashboard##https:t.co YNdmGzhvVaccinations##https:t.co YfahHVmRL pic YSLWMymdash Department of HealthMay , There is also to be a fullto outdoor sport and ato indoor club training in squads from May , followed by ato indoor competitive sport from May .Meanwhile from June , restriction on audiences in seated theatres and concert halls and other venues will be removed and theallowed of conferences and exhibitions. These decisions will be subject to review in June.First Minister Arlene Foster described the Irish Cup test event as a ldquobig win for people of all ages who have missed the shared experience of an outdoor match, concert or show.ldquoThe staging of this learning event will provide a valuable opportunity to gather learning which will inform our plans for the saferof all types of large audience-based events, she said.Deputy First Minister Michelle OrsquoNeill added: ldquoWe are fully committed to bringing back those aspects of le that people have missed so much over the last year. We know that for many families and friends, attending matches or events is an important part of their lives.ldquoI commend all those involved in the project, but most importantly I want to thank the supporters who will sign up to play a key role in ensuring future events can take place as safely as possible.Irish FA chief executive Patrick Nelson said it is a ldquopivotal moment on the journey back to normality.# @niexecutive agrees to allow spectators to attend Irish Cup final ## #IrishCupmdash Irish FAMay , ldquoWe are delighted that football can play its part. We have worked closely with our partners in the NI Executive and the Department for Communities, and will do likewise with the two clubs who reach the final, he said.ldquoWe understand the signicance of this increase in spectators for the final and also the importance of all attendees playing their part by adhering to the guidelines laid out and following the Covid testing requirements.ldquoWe are confident that this event will help further the case for increasing spectator numbers not just for football but for other sports and events across Northern Ireland, which is something everyone wants.Earlier, one further death of a patient who had previously tested positive for coronavirus in Northern Ireland was notied.The Department of Health also counted  new positive cases of the virus in the last -hour period.On Thursday morning there were  inpatients in hospital who were Covid positive, of whom three were in intensive care..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Irish Cup final to be Covid test event for NI us emergence from lockdown article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: government ruling nothing out indian variant cases double
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityData from Public Health Englandshows a rise in cases from  to , this week in the UK, with the agency saying cases were ldquorising in the community and it was assessing the impact and severity of the iant.Dr Susan Hopkins, Covid- strategic response director at PHE, said: ldquoWe need to act collectively and responsibly to ensure that iants do not impact on the progress we have all made to drive down levels of Covid- and the increased freedom that brings.In Bolton, which has one of the highest case rates of the iant in the country, mobile testing units have been deployed and door-to-door PCR Covid testing has been offered to , residents.A vaccine bus has been set up to increase uptake among those who are eligible.Meanwhile surge testing has been deployed in Sefton, Merseyside, after cases of the Indian iant were confirmed in the Formby area, with anyone over  who lives, works or studies in the area urged to take a PCR test.Measures have also been brought in where, including in parts of London.Speaking at a primary school in Ferryhill, County Durham, earlier, the Prime Minister said: ldquoIt is a iant of concern, we are anxious about it.ldquoAt the moment there is a very wide range of scientic opinion about what could happen.ldquoWe want to make sure we take all the prudential, cautious steps now that we could take, so there are meetings going on today to consider exactly what we need to do." data-title"HEALTH Coronavirus" data--holder"PA Graphics" data--notice"PA Graphics Press Association Images" data-credit"PA Graphics" data-usage-terms"" srcset"https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production https:image.assets.pressassociation.io v image production bcdbaeebdcfefYudGVudHNlYXJjaGFwaSwxNjIxMDIwMDk ..jpg w w" sizes" vw,vw,px, px"ldquoThere is a range of things we could do, we are ruling nothing out.Askedlocal lockdowns were possible, Mr Johnson said: ldquoThere are a range of things we could do, we want to make sure we grip it.ldquoObviously therersquos surge testing, therersquos surge tracing.ldquoIf we have to do other things, then of course the public would want us to rule nothing out.     ldquoWe have always been clear we would be led by the data.ldquoAt the moment, I can see nothing that dissuades me from thinking we will be able to go ahead on Monday and indeed on June  everywhere, but there may be things we have to do locally and we will not hesitate to do themthat is the advice we get." data-title"HEALTH Coronavirus" data--holder"PA Graphics" data--notice"PA Graphics Press Association Images" data-credit"PA Graphics" data-usage-terms"" cases of the iant and any clusters are being ldquorapidly investigated by local PHE teams, councils and NHS Test and Trace to identy the contacts of those who test positive.People are being encouraged to go for testing and to self-isolateneeded.PHE said there were ldquomany small dispersed clusters in London and it was working with borough councils on a local approach, which had already been effective at driving down iants.It added: ldquoAcross the North West, signicant work is under way with local councils and partners in specic areas where iant cases have been identied.Dr Hopkins urged people to follow local public health advice and said: ldquoCases of this iant are rising in the community and we are continuously monitoring its spread and severity to ensure we take rapid public health action.She added:ldquoTesting and isolating when required not only limits spread, it helps us to better understand how the iant behaves in the community which is vital to taking effective and proportionate action moving forward.ldquoIf yoursquore asked to take a test please do. The way to limit the spread of all iants is the same.ldquoKeep your distance, wash your hands regularly and thoroughly, cover your nose and mouth when inside, keep buildings well ventilated and meet people from other households outside.PHEis asking the public to continue to working from home and take up the offer of twice-weekly lateral flow tests.Layla Moran MP, Chair of the All-Party Parliamentary Group on Coronavirus, said: ldquoThe latest figures are deeply concerning and suggest the government failed to act swtly enough to prevent the Indian iant being imported into the UK.ldquoMinisters only added India to the red list several weeks after this mutation was identied as a iant of concern, by which time it was too late.ldquoOur cross-party report has called for countriesto be added to the lsquored listrsquo as soon as iants of concern are identied, and for quarantine rules to then come into force with immediate effect.ldquoThe government must rethink its flawed approach to internationaltravel and focus onpreventing the importation of iants, which scientists agree pose the biggest risk to our hard-won progress against Covid-.A spokeswoman for Blackburn with Darwen Council initially said extra vaccine doses had been secured so all people aged over  there could be offered the jab from next week amid rising cases.But in a statement released later on Thursday, the council said the vaccine would not be widely available to over-s, but only available ldquoin line with Government guidance.Earlier, askedmasks and social distancing would be scrapped next month, Mr Johnson said more announcements would be made before the end of this month.He added: ldquoI think we have to wait a little bit longer to see how the data is looking but I am cautiously optimistic about that and provided this Indian iant doesnrsquot take off in the way some people fear, I think certainly things could get back much, much closer to normality.Downing Street also said officials would not ldquorule anything out when askedthe Government was considering surge vaccinations to accompany surge testing in areas with spikes of new iants.The Prime Ministerrsquos official spokesman told a Westminster briefing: ldquoWe want to consider all options.Earlier, Professor Steven Riley, from Imperial College London, said whether the road map for England continued on its title: biden hails great day america mask wearing guidance eased
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityldquoToday is a great day for America, President Joe Biden said during a Rose Garden address heralding the new guidance from the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention .ldquoIf you are fully vaccinated, you no longer need to wear a mask, he said, summarising the new guidance and encouraging more Americans to roll up their sleeves. ldquoGet vaccinated mdash or wear a mask until you do. vw,vw,px, px"Vice President Kamala Harris listens as President Joe Biden speaks in the Rose Garden of the White House The guidance still calls for wearing masks in crowded indoor settings like buses, planes, hospitals, prisons and homeless shelters, but it will help clear the way for reopening workplaces, schools, and other venues mdash even removing the need for social distancing for those who are fully vaccinated.ldquoWe have all longed for this moment mdash when we can get back to some sense of normalcy, said Rochelle Walensky, director of the CDC, at an earlier White House briefing.The CDC and the Biden administration have faced pressure to ease restrictions on fully vaccinated people mdash those who are two weeks past their last required Covid- dose mdash in part to highlight the benefits of getting the jab.The countryrsquos aggressive vaccination campaign has paid off ndash US virus cases are at their lowest rate since September, deaths are at their lowest point since last April and the test positivity rate is at the lowest point since the pandemic began.Ms Walensky said the long-awaited change is thanks to the millions of people who have got vaccinated and is based on the latest science about how well those shots are working.ldquoAnyone who is fully vaccinated can participate in indoor and outdoor activities ndash large or small ndash without wearing a mask or physically distancing, Ms Walensky said. ldquoIf you are fully vaccinated, you can start doing the things that you had stopped doing because of the pandemic.      vw,vw,px, px"Mr Biden said it was a lsquogreat dayrsquo for America The new guidance is likely to open the door to confusion, since there is no sure-fire way for businesses or others to distinguish between those who are fully vaccinated and those who are not.Ms Walensky and Mr Biden said people who are not fully vaccinated should continue to wear masks indoors.ldquoWersquove gotten this far mdash please protect yourself until you get to the finish line, Mr Biden said, noting that most Americans under  are not yet fully vaccinated.He said the government was not going to enforce the mask wearing guidance on those not yet fully vaccinated.ldquoWersquore not going to go out and arrest people, he added.ldquoIf you havenrsquot been vaccinated, wear your mask for your own protection and the protection of the people who also have not been vaccinated yet.To date about  million Americans, more than % of the population, have received at least one dose of a Covid- vaccine and more than  million are fully vaccinated.The rate of new vaccinations has slowed in recent weeks, but with the authorisation on Wednesday of the Pfizer shot for children ages  to , a new burst of doses is expected in the coming days.ldquoAll of us, letrsquos be patient, be patient with one another, Mr Biden said, acknowledging some Americans might be hesitant about removing their masks after more than a year of living in a pandemic that has killed more than , in the US and more than . million people title: tesco launches new summer food collection for struggling families and children
story: Family and police ‘increasingly concerned’ for man missing since Sunday   Council gives the go ahead to big plans for TandrageeNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessNewsPeopleTesco launches new Summer Food Collection for struggling families and childrenTesco’s in Portadown is to hold an extra summer Food Collection for children and families.By Carmel RobinsonThursday, th May , : pm  "       "  This is a UK-wide initiative to support local families this summer.During the collection, which will take place in large Tesco stores from July  to  and in Express stores from July  to August , customers will be urged to donate long-le food to the Trussell Trust and FareShare to help them in their vital work to support families in communities across the UK. Tesco will again be topping up all customer donations with a % cash donation to the two charities.]]Donations are made at the launch of the Tesco Food Collection.Tesco UK  NI CEO Jason Tarry said: “Both the Trussell Trust and FareShare face extra demands during the summer, when children who would normally enjoy a healthy meal in school may miss out. That is why we have decided to hold this extra collection.”Charities FareShare and the Trussell Trust have welcomed the announcement.Emma Revie, Chief Executive of the Trussell Trust, added: “No one should face the indignity of needing emergency food. “Yet in the last year, food banks in our network provided record numbers of emergency food parcels to people struggling to afford the essentials. “This is not right but we know we can build a better future. “Thanks to the incredible ongoing generosity of Tesco, we are thrilled that customers will be able to support food banks during the Summer Food Collection. “Every donation makes such a dference and helps food banks in our network provide the best possible emergency support while we work together towards building a hunger free future,” said Emma.Spot checks on pupils as NI principal reveals Snapchat used to get ‘zombie’ drug Spice Read full story here--Editor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article. title: staycation northern ireland seven castles in ni that you can holiday in as coronavirus restricts ease
story: Tesco launches new Summer Food Collection for struggling families and children   Council gives the go ahead to big plans for TandrageeNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessNews]]Downhill Beachs golden sands stretch out towards Magilligan Point and is one of the longest beaches in Ireland. Mussenden Temple stands on the clf, from where there are views of counties Donegal Coast, Antrim and Londonderry. Staycation Northern Ireland: Seven Castles in NI that you can holiday in as Coronavirus restricts easeIf you’re planning a romantic getaway, make it a spectacular one.By The NewsroomThursday, th May , : pmUpdated Thursday, th May , : pm  "       "  Take your pick of these magical * castle retreats or stately manor homes, all in the most stunning locations in Northern Ireland. And all with plenty of interesting things to see and do around them. So, make dreams come true with a castle stay in Northern Ireland - evenit is only yours for a few days. . The Barbican GatelodgeStanding at the end of an old stone bridge across the Glenarm River, The Barbican Gatelodge is a charming building complete with gothic windows and a stone turret staircase. Early evening delivers the most spectacular views here. So get ready to head up to the roof garden to see the coastline in all its twilight glory. This self-catering accommodation is the perfect romantic hideaway and the ideal starting point for a road trip to discover the dramatic Causeway Coast, stopping off at the * Giant’s Causeway and * Carrick-a-Rede Rope Bridge en route. From the wonderful to the quirky, this is Northern Ireland’s past and it’s all yours to explore. There’s the perfect spot out there for your romantic getaway, so go get it.Photo: Google  "       "  Buy photo. Killyleagh Castle Towers, County DownBuilt in the th century by Norman knight, John de Courcy, Killyleagh Castle is the oldest inhabited castle in Ireland today, sitting close to the shores of Strangford Lough. The towers, where your self-catering property awaits, are by comparison mere newcomers. They didn’t put in an appearance till s and are actually built into the defensive walls of the castle. For the record, they go by the names of Ava and Blackwood.Photo: NITB  "       "  Buy photo. Ballygally Castle Hotel, County AntrimJust  miles from Belfast and close to Larne, the enchanting Ballygally Castle Hotelsits at the tip of the Causeway Coastal Route, with views all the way across the Irish Sea. The castle dates back to  and today is the only th century building in Northern Ireland still used as a residence. Character, charm, original beamed ceilings and restful contemporary décor add to the welcoming atmosphere. As does the reputedly friendly ghost. If you’re feeling brave enough, there’s a ‘ghost room’ in one of the towers where you can investigate the goings-on for yourself.Photo: NITB  "       "  Buy photo sits at the tip of the Causeway Coastal Route, with views all the way across the Irish Sea.The castle dates back to  and today is the only th century building in Northern Ireland still used as a residence.Character, charm, original beamed ceilings and restful contemporary décor add to the welcoming atmosphere. As does the reputedly friendly ghost. If you’re feeling brave enough, there’s a ‘ghost room’ in one of the towers where you can investigate the goings-on for yourself." layout"responsive" srcset"https:www.portadowntimes webimg TUFZMTMwODAMDE.jpg crop:,smartwidth w, https:www.portadowntimes webimg TUFZMTMwODAMDE.jpg crop:,smartwidth w" class"i-amphtml-layout-responsive i-amphtml-layout-size-defined" i-amphtml-layout"responsive". Helen’s Tower, County DownIf you like that top of the world feeling, Helen’s Tower is just made for you. In fact, it’s a castle just made for two, with sky-high views that go on forever. Perfect for a romantic getaway. Hidden on the edge of a winding country lane, this enchanting three storey, stone tower nestles deep in the woods on the Clandeboye Estate, perched high above the rolling hills of County Down with wonderful forest walks nearbyPhoto: NITB  "       "  Buy photoNext Page      Page  of                        This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us on    ExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryReader ShopUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter " fill"#ea"  ©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-kafWEX sc-feJyhm dbjzDR"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policy  News you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""  " "  "  scale translate " points"  .  . title: omagh mum fundraiser raises close to k in  hours
story: AN Omagh mother-of-three who has been diagnosed with terminal cancer has almost doubled her fundraising target of pound, to fly to Mexico for alternative treatment. Jemma McGowan, , was given the nightmare news that her chemotherapy would be stopped after medics found new tumours in her pelvic area and pubic bone on Monday. After researching alternative therapy to try and prolong her le, she is planning to travel to Mexico - but she needs at least pound, to do so. On Thursday morning, over pound, had been raised on her Go Fund Me page. In an update, Jemma said: My husband Clive and I have been just so overwhelmed by the generosity of family and friends and the whole community over the past few days. It really has brought a sense of hope back to me since I got my scan results on Monday, to have not only achieved my target figure but surpassed it by an insane amount - my miracle. I have received thousands of messages from people that are in similar situations, people that have battled and are winning as well as family members of the unlucky victims of this indiscriminate disease. I want to take this opportunity to thank everyone that has donated, shared my story and prayed for me and my family, I am truly blessed to have had this unimaginable support in such a short period of time. Hopefully in the next few days I will know a timeframe of the next stage of my journey.
